programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Its the battle of the London and South East chefs newcomers, Phil Howard and Graham Garrett and Marcus McGuinness. They kick things off with their starters, but which one is going to be first off the blocks?

programme.desc: Its the battle of the London and South East chefs newcomers, Phil Howard and Graham Garrett and Marcus McGuinness. They cook their main course, but only one chef will take gold?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Its the battle of the London and South East chefs returning contender, Phil Howard and Graham Garrett and Marcus McGuinness. Today is the final chance to impress the veteran with their dessert dishes.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's decision time on Great British Menu for the chefs from the London and South East region. One chef left the competition and only two remain to cook their entire menus for the Great British Menu judges, Prue Leith, Matthew Fort and Oliver Peyton.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Its the battle of the South West chefs returning contenders, Paul Ainsworth and Nathan Outlaw plus newcomer Simon Hulstone. They kick things off with their starters, but which one is going to be first off the blocks?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Its the battle of the South West chefs returning contenders, Paul Ainsworth and Nathan Outlaw plus newcomer Simon Hulstone. They cook their fish course, but which one but which one will prevail?

programme.desc: Its the battle of the South West chefs returning contenders, Paul Ainsworth and Nathan Outlaw plus newcomer Simon Hulstone. They cook their main course, but which chef will take gold?

programme.desc: Its the battle of the South West chefs returning contenders, Paul Ainsworth and Nathan Outlaw plus newcomer Simon Hulstone. Today is the final chance to impress the veteran with their dessert dishes.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's decision time on Great British Menu for the chefs from the South West region. One chef left the competition and only two remain to cook their entire menus for the Great British Menu judges, Prue Leith, Matthew Fort and Oliver Peyton.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The Great British Menu 2012 enters its final week. In todays programme the finalists cook their starters, which will be tasted and scored by the Great British Menu judges and veteran judge Richard Corrigan.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Today the finalists cook their fish dishes, which will be tasted and scored by the Great British Menu judges and veteran judge Marcus Wareing.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Today the chosen finalists cook their main courses, which will be tasted and scored by the Great British Menu judges and veteran judge Tom Kerridge.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Its Desserts day in the finals and the last chance for the competing chefs to impress the judges and veteran Angela Hartnett. The judges finally reveal the winning four dishes which will make up this years Great British Menu.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The winners have been announced and this final programme follows the successful chefs in the run up to the banquet, as they make the painstaking preparations, for what is one of the most important meals they will ever cook.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Today three of Scotlands top chefs, Jak ODonnell, Jimmy Lee, and Graham Campbell attempt to impress this weeks veteran judge. Returning finalist Jak is determined to make it to the banquet, but newcomers Jimmy and Graham are out to steal her crown.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Today Scottish chefs, Jak ODonnell, Jimmy Lee and Graham Campbell fight it out for the fish course. Graham is in a confident mood but returning finalist Jak and Jimmy are pushing him hard. Will the pressure prove too much for ambitious Graham?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Today Scottish chefs Jak ODonnell, Jimmy Lee and Graham Campbell are battling to plate up a perfect main course for this weeks veteran chef. Self-taught Jimmy is honouring his Mum with his rendition of her Chinese Beef Stew.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Today its the Scottish chefs last chance to impress, with the dessert course. Only two can cook for the judges tomorrow, and with one chef in the lead after a triumphant main, the pressures on for the other two to plate up perfection.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Today the two remaining Scottish chefs cook their entire menus again for the judges Prue Leith, Oliver Peyton and Matthew Fort. Theyre joined by WI Calendar Girl Angela Baker, who will help decide which chef will go forward to the National Finals.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Today three of the South Wests finest chefs - Jude Kereama, Josh Eggleton and Dominic Chapman - attempt to impress this weeks veteran judge with their starters.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Today the three South West chefs - Jude Kereama, Josh Eggleton and Dominic Chapman fight it out for the fish course. Despite school-boy errors yesterday, experienced Dominic is determined to get a high score today.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Today its a battle for the main course with the three South West chefs - Jude Kereama, Josh Eggleton and Dominic Chapman going head to head.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Today its the last chance for the South Wests chefs to impress, with the dessert course. Only two chefs can go through to cook for the judges so with everything to play for, who will plate up perfection and who will be sent packing?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Today the two remaining South West chefs cook their entire menus again for the judges Prue Leith, Oliver Peyton and Matthew Fort. Joining the judges is Radhika Bynon, a member of the Forest Gate, Womens Institute, a modern urban group of women.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Today representing Wales Stephen Gomes, Adam Bannister and Phil Carmichael are challenged to plate up perfect starter courses for this weeks veteran judge.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Today the three Welsh chefs - Stephen Gomes, Adam Bannister and Phil Carmichael fight it out for the fish course. Experimental chef Stephen is determined to prove himself with a fish course honouring the WIs tradition of preserving.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Its a battle for the main course with the Welsh chefs - Stephen Gomes, Adam Bannister and Phil Carmichael are going head to head. With all 3 chefs paying homage to Welsh lamb; the pressure is on to deliver a main worthy of their veterans approval.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Today its the tricky dessert course, and the last chance for the Welsh chefs to secure their place in tomorrows regional final. Only two can make it through, and one will leave the competition for good.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Today the two remaining Welsh chefs cook their four courses again for the judges Prue Leith, Oliver Peyton and Matthew Fort along with guest judge and long serving WI member Rosemary Bishton.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Three of Northern Irelands top chefs Chris McGowan, Danni Barry and Ben Arnold go head to head with their starter courses to impress this weeks veteran judge.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Today three of Northern Irelands top chefs Chris McGowan, Danni Barry and Ben Arnold are cooking their fish courses. Ambitious Ben is determined to steal Chriss regional crown.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Today its a battle for the main course for three of Northern Irelands finest chefs Chris McGowan, Danni Barry and Ben Arnold. Ambitious Ben is out to prove himself with a perfect lamb main course.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Its dessert day and the Northern Irish chefs are all striving for one of the two spots in tomorrows Regional Final. The pressure is intense, and in the end one chef must leave the competition empty handed.
